content:
• Friday, October 7, 2011
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA -6.3%) plunged yet again on fears of a government crackdown (I, II) related to its...

    Sina (SINA -6.3%) plunged yet again on fears of a government crackdown (I, II) related to its Weibo microblogging platform. The trigger in this instance was a report from a Hong Kong paper claiming new social media regulations will soon be rolled out, possibly including a requirement that users register with their real names.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM
  • MNTA

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MNTA) rises 1.7% AH after announcing it's won a temporary...

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MNTA) rises 1.7% AH after announcing it's won a temporary restraining order against Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI) and two other firms regarding the sale of a generic version of its Lovenox drug, pending an Oct. 20 hearing. Momenta requested an injunction on Monday. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM
  • WMT

    Wal-Mart (WMT +1.8%) outperformed today after Barclays reiterated an Overweight ahead of next...

    Wal-Mart (WMT +1.8%) outperformed today after Barclays reiterated an Overweight ahead of next week's shareholder meeting. The firm thinks Wal-Mart's management transition has gone smoothly, and though worried about macro conditions, expects the company to benefit from the boost in disposable income provided by lower gas prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • SOA

    Southwall Technologies (OTC:SWTX +43.8%) soars today after agreeing earlier to be bought by...

    Southwall Technologies (OTC:SWTX +43.8%) soars today after agreeing earlier to be bought by Solutia (SOA +1%) in an all cash deal for $13.60 per share, a 45% premium over Thursday's closing price.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • CVE

    Cenovus Energy (CVE +2.6%) bucks a JP Morgan downgrade to trade higher with the rest of its...

    Cenovus Energy (CVE +2.6%) bucks a JP Morgan downgrade to trade higher with the rest of its peers as crude continues to rack up gains today. The firm cut the driller to neutral on valuation, saying it has less downside protection if oil prices decline.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • S

    BTIG's Walter Piecyk provides a brutal recap of Sprint's (S -19.6%) investor day, the news from...

    BTIG's Walter Piecyk provides a brutal recap of Sprint's (S -19.6%) investor day, the news from which (I, I, III) has crushed Sprint shares. Among other things, Piecyk claims CFO Joe Euteneuer was "laughed at" for his failure to provide details about Sprint's costly 4G plans. Tero Kuittinen thinks Sprint's moves are "just awesome for Verizon (NYSE:VZ)."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • CREE

    Cree (CREE +6.4%) surges on new takeover speculation. The fact that 18.2% of Cree's float was...

    Cree (CREE +6.4%) surges on new takeover speculation. The fact that 18.2% of Cree's float was shorted as of Sept. 15 helps explain how a mere rumor could lead to a big move higher. GE and Philips (NYSE:PHG) have been named in the past as potentially interested parties.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • OKE

    Oneok (OKE +1.6%) gains after Citigroup upgrades the shares to buy. Citi says the company is...

    Oneok (OKE +1.6%) gains after Citigroup upgrades the shares to buy. Citi says the company is well positioned for midstream growth in its North American operations, and considers it "high growth/high yield hybrid."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • CAH

    Cardinal Health (CAH +0.8%)) gains after Susquehanna ups the shares to postive from neutral on...

    Cardinal Health (CAH +0.8%)) gains after Susquehanna ups the shares to postive from neutral on valuation, saying the company should benefit from upcoming launches of some of its generic drugs.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • NGG

    Shares of British utility National Grid (NGG +2.1%) rise on an HSBC upgrade to neutral. HSBC...

    Shares of British utility National Grid (NGG +2.1%) rise on an HSBC upgrade to neutral. HSBC says the company is poised to grow, plus U.K. regulator Ofgem will need to allocate $48B of transmission investment over the next few years.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • MRK

    Merck (MRK +1.1%) gains after winning FDA approval for Juvisync, the first pill to treat...

    Merck (MRK +1.1%) gains after winning FDA approval for Juvisync, the first pill to treat diabetes and high cholesterol together. The drug is a combination of the company's diabetes drug Januvia and its blockbuster cholesterol treatment Zocor.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • ILMN

    Illumina's (ILMN -32.2%) warning is taking a heavy toll on many companies dependent on medical...

    Illumina's (ILMN -32.2%) warning is taking a heavy toll on many companies dependent on medical research spending (I, II). Some of the other names tanking in sympathy: PKI -7.8%. LMNX -7.3%. TMO -5.7%. BRKR -3.5%. WAT -8%. PACB -11.4%. Fluidgm (FLDM -7.8%) is also among the casualties in spite of reaffirming its 2011 outlook.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • M

    Shares of MasterCard (M -1.1%) and Visa (V -0.5%) trade lower with other financials today, even...

    Shares of MasterCard (M -1.1%) and Visa (V -0.5%) trade lower with other financials today, even as Deutsche weighs in with Buy ratings for both firms. Analysts say a "worldwide secular shift" to electronic payments will benefit global payments companies, and "noise" over the effect of the Durbin Amendment may be overblown.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • PSS

    Collective Brands (PSS +2.4%) gets a boost from a Susquehanna upgrade to positive from neutral...

    Collective Brands (PSS +2.4%) gets a boost from a Susquehanna upgrade to positive from neutral on valuation, citing potential upside catalysts coming from the company's strategic review process.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • KWT

    Solar stocks are sharply reversing course (KWT -5.8%) after 3 days of big gains (I, II, III),...

    Solar stocks are sharply reversing course (KWT -5.8%) after 3 days of big gains (I, II, III), and a bearish report from BofA's Joe Osha could be a major culprit. Like Solarbuzz, Osha expects industry module supply in 2012 to vastly outstrip demand, leading prices to crash further, and a number of module vendors to be driven out.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • ICA

    Mexican construction firm Empresas ICA (ICA -3.5%), is lower today after Morgan Stanley cut the...

    Mexican construction firm Empresas ICA (ICA -3.5%), is lower today after Morgan Stanley cut the shares to equal-weight. The firm says the industry remains depressed, and recent asset sales are likely to result in a lower earnings multiple.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • SPPJY

    Sappi (SPP +3.1%) trades higher after the maker of paper and pulp products announces a series of...

    Sappi (SPP +3.1%) trades higher after the maker of paper and pulp products announces a series of restructuring moves for its underperforming European and South African operations. Sappi expects to take restructuring charges of ~$160M for FQ4 '11, which ended in September.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • GS

    Financials are trading lower, possibly due to Fed president Dennis Lockhart's earlier comments...

    Financials are trading lower, possibly due to Fed president Dennis Lockhart's earlier comments that regulators "can't guarantee" against the failure of individual financial firms, nor have they put a system in place that would allow orderly failures of the largest financial firms without taxpayer rescues: Goldman Sachs (GS -5.4%), Morgan Stanley (MS -6.5%), JP Morgan (JPM -5%), Bank of America (BAC -5.6%), Citigroup (C -5.2%), American International (AIG -4.7%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • S

    Sprint (S -10%) continues heading lower after its CFO says the carrier's 4G LTE rollout will...

    Sprint (S -10%) continues heading lower after its CFO says the carrier's 4G LTE rollout will cost $10B over the next two years - far more than the $4B-$5B speculated by some analysts. Meanwhile, jilted partner Clearwire (CLWR -31.4%) is claiming Sprint is still dependent on it to deploy LTE, given its lack of spectrum. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 6 Comments
  • BB

    Investors buying Research In Motion (RIMM -4.9%) as a value play run the risk of walking into a...

    Investors buying Research In Motion (RIMM -4.9%) as a value play run the risk of walking into a "classic value trap," Morningstar warns, unconvinced the company has a credible plan to reverse its declining relevance in the smartphone market. Don't place much stock in takeover chatter either, with "the two co-CEOs and Chairmen likely against any such move."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • FTS

    ITC Holdings (ITC -4.8%) trades lower after Deutsche cut the shares to hold. Deutsche cites...

    ITC Holdings (ITC -4.8%) trades lower after Deutsche cut the shares to hold. Deutsche cites concern over the utility's return on equity getting challenged and potentially reduced by FERC in New England, given the low interest rate environment.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • AAL

    Sterne Agee gets a tepid response from the market after initiating the airliners today: AMR (AMR...

    Sterne Agee gets a tepid response from the market after initiating the airliners today: AMR (AMR -0.6%), Allegiant Travel (ALGT -2%), Delta (DAL -2%), JetBlue (JBLU -0.2%) and United Continental (UAL -3.2%) are all started with buys, and US Airways (LCC -3%) and Southwest Airlines (LUV -4%) are initiated with a neutral.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • VEOEY

    Veolia (VE -4.3%) takes a hit after UBS cut the shares to sell from neutral on valuation plus a...

    Veolia (VE -4.3%) takes a hit after UBS cut the shares to sell from neutral on valuation plus a lack of visibility in its restructuring plans.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • HRS

    Harris (HRS -4.1%) dips after Benchmark cut the shares to Hold, citing the potential downside to...

    Harris (HRS -4.1%) dips after Benchmark cut the shares to Hold, citing the potential downside to international RF communications sales and government budget cuts.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • S

    Sprint (S -7.6%) has given back its early gains and then some, after the company says it needs...

    Sprint (S -7.6%) has given back its early gains and then some, after the company says it needs more money to finance its 4G buildout.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • GLGLF

    Canaccord and Raymond James pile on to GLG Life Tech (GLGL -7.5%), downgrading the shares a day...

    Canaccord and Raymond James pile on to GLG Life Tech (GLGL -7.5%), downgrading the shares a day late and a dollar short after yesterday's -41% plunge. Both firms cite the company's disappointing business update and near-term execution issues. Cannacord cuts the stock to a hold, while Raymond James reduces it to market perform.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • CVTI

    Covenant Transportation (CVTI -21%) plunges after projecting a surprise Q3 loss. The trucking...

    Covenant Transportation (CVTI -21%) plunges after projecting a surprise Q3 loss. The trucking company says a 9-10% decrease in revenue miles/truck as costs for wages, fuel, and insurance rise is tagging the bottom line, and expects a loss of $500K-$1.7M vs. expectations for a $2.3M profit. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -4%) and AMC Networks (AMCX +2%) have struck a multi-year deal granting Netflix...

    Netflix (NFLX -4%) and AMC Networks (AMCX +2%) have struck a multi-year deal granting Netflix exclusive distribution rights to The Walking Dead, and non-exclusive rights to other shows. AMC is rising on the news, but Netflix is selling off today, as Caris raises concerns about the potential renegotiation of a licensing deal with EPIX.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 5 Comments
  • RMBS

    Rambus (RMBS -4.4%) sells off after the memory technology firm is grilled in court over the...

    Rambus (RMBS -4.4%) sells off after the memory technology firm is grilled in court over the shredding of documents that could harm its case in a patent infringement suit with Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA). Rambus is still awaiting a verdict in a separate case against memory makers Micron (NASDAQ:MU) and Hynix.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL) drops 3.2% after Goldman suspends coverage of the display...

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL) drops 3.2% after Goldman suspends coverage of the display technology company. Goldman had only launched coverage of Universal Display in June with a Buy rating, and most recently had a $65 PT.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • GEOY

    Satellite imagery provider GeoEye (NASDAQ:GEOY) rises 7.4% on strong volume. StreetInsider...

    Satellite imagery provider GeoEye (NASDAQ:GEOY) rises 7.4% on strong volume. StreetInsider claims the move is the result of takeover speculation.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • SMSMY

    Sims Metals (SMS +5.5%) shoots up after the firm announces an "onmarket" share repurchasement...

    Sims Metals (SMS +5.5%) shoots up after the firm announces an "onmarket" share repurchasement program that allows the company to buy back up to 10% of issued capital over a 12-month period on the Australian exchange commencing Oct 24.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • VHC

    Virnetx (VHC +2%) pops on talk of Carl Icahn taking a stake in the company.

    Virnetx (VHC +2%) pops on talk of Carl Icahn taking a stake in the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • SNE

    Sony (SNE -3.5%) trades off this morning after issuing a "no response" response to the WSJ...

    Sony (SNE -3.5%) trades off this morning after issuing a "no response" response to the WSJ report yesterday that they were in talks to buy out Ericsson's (ERIC -1.3%) stake in their joint venture.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • GDOT

    Shares of Green Dot (NYSE:GDOT) gain 4.4% after Deutsche comes in and initiates shares with a...

    Shares of Green Dot (NYSE:GDOT) gain 4.4% after Deutsche comes in and initiates shares with a Buy rating and $41 price target. The firm jumps on GDOT's position in the driver's seat of a "huge untapped" market for prepaid cards, and sees the Durbin Amendment being net positive for the industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • QTM-OLD

    Quantum (QTM-OLD +5.9%) adds to yesterday's gains courtesy of an upgrade to Buy from...

    Quantum (QTM-OLD +5.9%) adds to yesterday's gains courtesy of an upgrade to Buy from Wunderlich's Brian Freed. Freed's checks suggest healthy demand for enterprise storage products, and he sees market share gains, new products, sales hires, and a reseller agreement with NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP) all giving Quantum a boost. (NTAP checks)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR -19.5%) shares tumble after Sprint (S +8.3%) says it will stop selling phones...

    Clearwire (CLWR -19.5%) shares tumble after Sprint (S +8.3%) says it will stop selling phones and other devices compatible with CLWR's network at the end of next year. Sprint's president of network operations says the company is already building its own 4G data network and will inaugurate it next summer.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • ECA

    Encana (ECA -1.9%) trades lower after it agrees to sell its majority interest in Cabin Gas, a...

    Encana (ECA -1.9%) trades lower after it agrees to sell its majority interest in Cabin Gas, a British Columbian natural-gas processing plant, to Enbridge (ENB +0.2%) for $211M. The sale is part of an ongoing effort by the company to divest itself of its midstream natural gas assets and focus on its core upstream business.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • IPGP

    IPG Photonics (IPGP +14.9%) takes off after scoring a major victory in its legal battle with...

    IPG Photonics (IPGP +14.9%) takes off after scoring a major victory in its legal battle with IMRA. Needham, however, is reiterating a Hold: while believing yesterday's ruling removes a "major overhang," it thinks "an economic cloud continues to hover" over the laser manufacturer, along with other industrial tech names.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • PSMT

    Shares of PriceSmart (NASDAQ:PSMT) move 7.2% higher after a key metric improves, leading a pack...

    Shares of PriceSmart (NASDAQ:PSMT) move 7.2% higher after a key metric improves, leading a pack of retailers poking out gains as some slivers of light emerge from sales reports and retail forecasts. Gainers: DLTR +3.3%, M +2%, KSS +2.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • DAL

    Sterne Agee lines up Delta Air Lines (DAL +2.1%) in its sights, assigning shares a Buy rating...

    Sterne Agee lines up Delta Air Lines (DAL +2.1%) in its sights, assigning shares a Buy rating and $18 price target. The firm likes DAL's financial strength relative to peers, and says it's in a position to "reduce capacity and improve cost structure and asset utilization at the same time." The lofty price objective set by the firm reps 125% upside potential for shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • AUO

    AU Optronics (AUO -1%) is off slightly after announcing its September sales declined 21.6% Y/Y....

    AU Optronics (AUO -1%) is off slightly after announcing its September sales declined 21.6% Y/Y. This led its overall Q3 revenue come in at $3.25B, well below a consensus of $3.71B. The decline was driven by a major drop in shipments of large LCD panels, the result of soft TV demand. The market's muted response suggests a weak report was expected. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • IDT

    Shares of IDT fall 10% after the company reports Q4 profit fell on weak phone card revenue....

    Shares of IDT fall 10% after the company reports Q4 profit fell on weak phone card revenue. Though revenue increased 15% Y/Y to $408M for the period, EPS came in at a penny - missing the consensus estimate of analysts by $0.23.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • ILMN

    Illumina (ILMN -32.8%) is crushed following its Q3 warning. Citi, which smartly downgraded...

    Illumina (ILMN -32.8%) is crushed following its Q3 warning. Citi, which smartly downgraded shares in advance, is slashing its PT to $32, arguing Illumina's growth trajectory is now "called into question." Auriga is maintaining a Buy, citing Illumina's position in the next-gen DNA sequencing market. In addition to Life Sciences (LIFE -5.5% - previously), Affymetrix (AFFX -5.5%) is selling off on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • TMO

    Thermo Fisher Scientific (NYSE:TMO) loses 5.6% after it gets lumped in with the group of...

    Thermo Fisher Scientific (NYSE:TMO) loses 5.6% after it gets lumped in with the group of companies (I, II, III) that could see a revenue hit from lower academic research spending.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • MWW

    Monster Worldwide (MWW +1.6%) trades higher after today's better-than-expected jobs report....

    Monster Worldwide (MWW +1.6%) trades higher after today's better-than-expected jobs report. Shares could also be getting a boost from a reported 7% Y/Y improvement in September for Monster's employment index. LinkedIn (LNKD -1.1%), which surged following a weak jobs report in June, is selling off.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • AOBC

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC) +13.6% premarket after the company says it plans to sell off its...

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC) +13.6% premarket after the company says it plans to sell off its perimeter security business to focus on its core gun manufacturing business. Perimeter security has deteriorated significantly since the unit's 2009 acquisition in part because of reduced government spending, CEO James Debney says.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM | 1 Comment
  • KBH

    KB Home (NYSE:KBH), Beazer Homes (NYSE:BZH) and Toll Brothers (NYSE:TOL) settle a court fight...

    KB Home (NYSE:KBH), Beazer Homes (NYSE:BZH) and Toll Brothers (NYSE:TOL) settle a court fight with their partner in a Las Vegas development that may make it easier for the $1.2B project to exit bankruptcy. KBH +2.7%, BZH +7.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM

  • The dollar is diving against most major currencies. The euro crosses above the $1.35 level for...

    The dollar is diving against most major currencies. The euro crosses above the $1.35 level for the first time this month. The loonie is the big winner so far today, +1.2%, as the NFP number combines with a big beat in the Canadian employment report.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM | 1 Comment

  • Government bond prices plummet (yields up) in the wake of the NFP number. U.S. 30 year bond...

    Government bond prices plummet (yields up) in the wake of the NFP number. U.S. 30 year bond futures are down nearly 2 full handles to 140.39.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM

  • U.S. stock index futures surge on the NFP print. S&P 500 +1.0% after being slightly red...

    U.S. stock index futures surge on the NFP print. S&P 500 +1.0% after being slightly red before the number.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM
  • ILMN

    Another casualty from Illumina's (NASDAQ:ILMN) preliminary Q3 report (previous): Shares of Life...

    Another casualty from Illumina's (NASDAQ:ILMN) preliminary Q3 report (previous): Shares of Life Technologies (NASDAQ:LIFE) sink 11% premarket as heightened fears over diminishing revenue washes over companies that depend on robust academic research budgets.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM
  • BRKR

    Bruker (NASDAQ:BRKR) falls 9% premarket after Illumina's (NASDAQ:ILMN) Q3 earnings miss taints...

    Bruker (NASDAQ:BRKR) falls 9% premarket after Illumina's (NASDAQ:ILMN) Q3 earnings miss taints shares on the outlook for "sluggishness" in the U.S. academic market.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 AM
  • WYNN

    Shares of Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) gain 1.7% premarket after catching an upgrade from Credit...

    Shares of Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) gain 1.7% premarket after catching an upgrade from Credit Suisse to Outperform from Neutral on "compelling valuation."

     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 AM

  • Canada adds 60.9K jobs in September, smashing estimates for a rise of 15K. The unemployment rate...

    Canada adds 60.9K jobs in September, smashing estimates for a rise of 15K. The unemployment rate falls from 7.3% to 7.1%. The loonie gets a nice pop on the news, now buying $0.9660.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 AM
  • LYG

    Moody's downgrades 12 U.K. financial institutions, citing the lowering or removal of government...

    Moody's downgrades 12 U.K. financial institutions, citing the lowering or removal of government support. The agency cuts Lloyds TSB (LYG -3.9%) and Santander U.K. (STD) by a notch, and RBS (RBS -3.4%) by two notches. There is no change for Barclays (BCS -1.7%) and HSBC (HBC -0.1%). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 AM
